Directives: radio-field

radio-field

radio-field(attribute, disable, help, label, tabIndex, uid, value)

Renders a radio <input> with optional label. This type of component is well-suited for small enumerations.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
attribute String

Name of the attribute within the parent form-for directive's model object. This attributes specifies the data-binding target for the input. Dot notation (ex "address.street") is supported.
disable Boolean

Disable input element. (Note the name is disable and not disabled to avoid collisions with the HTML5 disabled attribute).
help String

Optional help tooltip to display on hover. By default this makes use of the Angular Bootstrap tooltip directive and the Font Awesome icon set.
label String

Optional field label displayed after the radio input. (Although not required, it is strongly suggested that you specify a value for this attribute.) HTML is allowed for this attribute
tabIndex int

Optional custom tab index for input; by default this is 0 (tab order chosen by the browser)
uid String

Optional ID to assign to the inner element; A unique ID will be auto-generated if no value is provided.
value Object

Value to be assigned to model if this radio component is selected.
Source:
  • directives/radio-field.js, line 1
Example
// To render a radio group for gender selection you might use the following markup:
<radio-field label="Female" attribute="gender" value="f"></radio-field>
<radio-field label="Male" attribute="gender" value="m"></radio-field>
